item.title: Overwatch 2's Persona 5 Collab Could Spell the End of the Game, If You Listen to the Internet
item.description:
On March 7, 2023, during Season 3 of Overwatch 2 , Blizzard began its very first external IP crossover in the hero shooter with an event featuring One Punch Man . While there were a couple of other collaborations scattered throughout the next several updates, the Cowboy Bebop crossover in Season 9, nearly a year later, started a new paradigm. From then on, Overwatch 2 has had at least one collab every season – and in Season 18, the Phantom Thieves of Persona 5 have stolen their way into Future Earth with skins, challenges, and Easter eggs galore.

However, there is a hilarious and unfortunate trend with many live service games that collaborate with Persona 5 : they shut down. Enough titles have seen this phenomenon take place, where it has become a meme known as the " Persona 5 Curse." While the Overwatch 2 x Persona 5 collab will almost certainly not negatively impact the hero shooter, internet superstition might say otherwise.

What Is the Persona 5 Collab Curse?

And Will It Affect Overwatch 2?

Crossover events are not exactly new in the gaming industry, but they have reached a fever pitch in the last decade thanks to games like Fortnite . Gamers love seeing two of their favorite universes collide – and companies love the revenue such collaborations inevitably create.

It is no surprise Persona 5 is a major stop for the collab train. After all, it won Best RPG at The Game Awards 2017, and might have had a shot at Game of the Year, if not for Breath of the Wild . One would think crossing over with Persona 5 would bring nothing but dividends to its collaboration partners.

Even so, the exact opposite has happened to many live service games that have done Persona 5 collabs. Games like Dragalia Lost , Nier Reincarnation , Fullmetal Alchemist Mobile , Sword Art Online: Memory Defrag , and War of the Visions: Final Fantasy Brave Exvius collaborated with Persona 5 , only to end service within the next few years. While this is far from proof that the collab was the cause of their shutdowns, it is a rather curious coincidence that it has happened so many times.

All Live Service Games Persona 5 Has Crossed Over With

To Be Released

That said, there are plenty of other live service games that are still going strong after crossing over with Persona 5 . Granblue Fantasy , Puzzle & Dragons , and AFK Arena have all done Persona 5 collabs in the past, and have yet to reach end of service, even after several years. This alone proves the so-called Persona 5 Curse does not affect every game that collabs with the JRPG, and is instead an example of confirmation bias.

It is also important to note that all of these shuttered titles were live service mobile games, largely of the gacha variety. The market for these sorts of games is quite saturated, and often dominated by a handful of heavy-hitting gacha titles like Genshin Impact , Honkai Star Rail , and Fate: Grand Order . Less-popular titles must fight for the scraps left over by these giants, which could lead them to try to collaborate with big names like Persona 5 . Thus, it is more likely that the games that succumbed to the Persona 5 curse were already struggling before crossing over with the JRPG, with the collab being unable to save them.

Overwatch 2 is in no danger of shutting down any time soon. It isn’t a mobile game; its gacha is purely cosmetics-based via Overwatch 2 ’s revamped Loot Box system, and the game is in one of its healthiest points since its release in 2022, thanks to big swings like Perks and Stadium. Overwatch 2 may shut down someday in the distant future, but it won’t be because of Persona 5 .

item.title: How to Get the Hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest
item.description:
There are plenty of handy tools in 99 Nights in the Forest that make your run smoother and more successful. Some, like axes and rods, help you gather raw materials and food ingredients, while others, such as sacks, let you store items for crafting or cooking later on.

The hammer, which at first looks like a typical building tool, actually has a different purpose in this Roblox experience. Instead of creating objects, it’s mainly used to move things around your base. This tool is essential if you want to give your base a neat finish; you can rearrange tents, beds, or traps that would otherwise be stuck in place. When setting up defensive walls with logs, the hammer also helps you reposition any misplaced ones to cover gaps.

How to Get the Hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest

There are two ways players can get a hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest : either by crafting it at the Tool Workshop or by picking the Blacksmith or Decorator class .

If you choose either of these classes, you’ll start with a free hammer in your inventory. The catch is that both are locked behind an in-game currency wall. The Blacksmith costs 300 Diamonds to unlock, while the Decorator costs 40 Diamonds . If you don’t want to spend Diamonds or prefer starting with another class, you’ll need to forge the hammer yourself.

To make a hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest , you’ll need to locate the Tool Workshop inside the forest . At the beginning, it won’t appear marked on your map, but you can find it on the bottom-right side. Look for a large structure with an entrance covered by tree sticks and an anvil symbol above it. Once you reach it, use your axe to break through the wooden barrier.

Be ready, though, enemies will rush out from inside, so have traps and weapons prepared to handle them.

After clearing the area, collect the three anvil pieces (base, front, and back) scattered around the building and attach them to the blueprint at the center . Then, go to the side crafting table, select the hammer recipe, and place 5 Logs and 5 Scrap onto the anvil . Wait a short moment, and the hammer will be ready.

For those who don’t know, logs can be obtained by chopping down any tree with an axe , while scrap can be found in abandoned areas like houses, clinics, or chests, always in the form of metal pieces such as microwaves, bolts, or washing machines.

How to Use the Hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest

Once you have the hammer, you can keep it until the end of the round. It doesn’t have limited charges or disappear after use, so players can freely rely on it throughout their time in the game.

To use the hammer in 99 Nights in the Forest , equip it from your backpack slots , then click on the item you want to move . The item will be picked up in your inventory, and you can put it anywhere you want. If the furniture or logs aren't where you like them, just grab the hammer again to set them properly.

445
8.8 /10

Roblox

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals New Mega Evolution Debut for October 2025 Raid Day
item.description:
Pokemon GO has revealed the addition of Mega Metagross in a Raid Day on October 4. Expanding the list of Mega Evolutions available to Pokemon GO players, Scopely will give the spotlight to a pocket monster from one of the most beloved generations.

Metagross is a pseudo-Legendary Pokemon with an imposing appearance that resembles a mechanized arachnid. Introduced with the release of Pokemon Ruby and Pokemon Sapphire , the most notable appearance in both the games and the anime is Steven's Metagross, the Champion of the Hoenn region. With the introduction of the Gen 3 remakes, Metagross unlocked even more power with the introduction of its Mega Evolution, in which its arms become legs, and new legs appear on the back of its head. Metagross is a powerful creature beloved by fans, and its variant is on its way to Pokemon GO .

Mega Metagross Debuting in Pokemon GO in Upcoming Event

Pokemon GO has announced the debut of Mega Metagross in a Mega Raid Day that will take place on Saturday, October 4, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time. During the event, trainers will battle the Steel/Psychic-type Pokemon in raids, with the possibility of a shiny one appearing. The Mega Metagross caught in these raids will know the Fast Attack Shadow Claw, while Metagross can learn this move after the event ends by using the Elite Fast TM. To hype players up, Pokemon GO will increase the limit on Remote Raid Passes to 20 from October 3 at 5 pm to October 4 at 8 pm PT. Players will be able to receive up to five additional Raid Passes by spinning Gym Photo Discs.

  • Date: Saturday, October 4, 2025, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time
  • New Pokemon: Mega Metagross (can be shiny)
  • Featured Attack
    • Metagross encountered in Mega Raids will know the Fast Attack Shadow Claw. After the event, Metagross will be able to learn the featured attack via Elite Fast TM.

  • Event Bonuses
    • Remote Raid Pass limit increased to 20 from Friday, October 3, at 5 pm to Saturday, October 4, 2025, at 8 pm PT.
    • Receive up to five additional free Raid Passes from spinning Gym Photo Discs (for a total of six).
    • Increased chance of encountering Shiny Metagross from Mega Raids.

  • Event Ticket
    • Price: $4.99
    • Where to get: in-game
    • Rewards include
      • Eight additional Raid Passes from spinning Gym Photo Discs (for a daily total of 14)
      • Increased chance to get Rare Candy XL from Raid Battles
      • +5,000 XP from Raid Battles*
      • 2× Stardust from Raid Battles

  • These bonuses will be effective on Saturday, October 4, 2025, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time.
  • *If the Global Challenge during Steel Skyline is complete, Trainers who also have a Mega Metagross Raid Day ticket will earn an additional 5,000 XP from Raid Battles.
  • Mega Metagross Raid Day Ultra Ticket Box
    • Price: $4.99
    • Where to get: Pokemon GO Web Store
    • Comes with: an event ticket and a bonus Premium Battle Pass

  • XP Celebration Event
  • To celebrate the coming leveling update on October 15, 2025, all Trainers will be able to enjoy the following bonuses until October 14, 2025, at 11:59 pm local time. These bonuses will stack with bonuses from other Pokemon GO events.
    • 2× Catch XP from Nice, Great, and Excellent Throws
    • +3,000 XP from winning raids
    • +3,000 XP from winning Max Battles
    • Timed Research will be available for all Trainers over level 5. This expansive research awards over 7 million XP

For $4.99, players will be able to purchase an in-game ticket that will give them even more bonuses, including an additional 5,000 XP and double Stardust when participating in raids, and an increased chance of obtaining Rare Candy XL in these battles. Through the Pokemon GO Web store, players can purchase a $4.99 Ultra Ticket Box for the Mega Metagross Raid Day, which comes with an event ticket and a Premium Battle Pass at no additional cost. Still celebrating the Pokemon GO leveling update, players will receive extra XP by winning raids and Mega Raids, and by making Nice throws or better by October 14.

Mega Metagross Raid Day isn't the only event of its kind coming soon, as Mega Camerupt will debut in Pokemon GO on September 28. Other events coming in the next few days include Shadow Groudon Raid Weekend on September 30, and Community Day featuring Solosis on October 12.

101
8.3 /10

Pokémon GO

item.title: Subnautica 2 Reveals New Kind of Leviathan
item.description:
Subnautica 2 has revealed a new type of Leviathan called the Collector. A deep-sea predator of gargantuan proportions, the creature is likely to make exploration in Subnautica 2 significantly more unnerving.

Leviathans in the Subnautica franchise are massive underwater organisms spanning numerous species, some of which can grow as large as skyscrapers. Not all creatures classified as Leviathans are predators, but plenty of them do hunt for sustenance in the lore of the hit survival games. The upcoming Subnautica 2 will include both new and returning Leviathans.

Subnautica 2 Reveals Terrifying Cthulhu-Inspired Leviathan

Unknown Worlds Entertainment has now revealed one such creature in a new devlog featuring longtime Subnautica developer Cory Strader, who was an art director on the first two entries in the series and is once again leading the visual development of the third installment. The new Leviathan is called the Collector, a gargantuan squid-like creature whose design is influenced by Cthulhu. Strader said the design aimed to create a predator that feels distinct from those in previous games.

Visual development led the team down a design path spanning from thumbnail silhouettes to a lifelike model with four long tentacles and a split-body glow motif meant to evoke shock while simultaneously being easily seen from afar. The new devlog also delves under the hood, revealing what the developers dubbed the "classic AI" model built in Unreal Engine behavior trees. While the video doesn't go into many specifics of Unknown Worlds' development stack, one prior leak suggested Subnautica 2 is built using Unreal Engine 5.5.4.

Subnautica 2 Leviathans and Other Creatures Will Be Much More Reactive

The developers describe the Collector as an "easily irritable" creature with a strong dislike for anything it doesn't recognize. The player character hence won't be its favorite organism in the world, but it can also get distracted by fauna or things like flares. According to Unknown Worlds, one of the goals with all the creatures in Subnautica 2 was to make them more reactive than in the previous games, a feature the team hopes to achieve through the so-called "stimulus" system. The technology enables organisms to continually reevaluate situations, supporting emergent gameplay and improving replayability.

Subnautica 2 has been targeting a 2026 early access release since its messy delay back in July 2025, which ended with Unknown Worlds co-founders ousted from the studio after the parent company, Krafton, concluded that the game wasn't in a state to launch, accusing them of abandoning their responsibilities. The founders filed a wrongful dismissal lawsuit in response, alleging the South Korean publisher removed them just so that it didn't have to pay a $250 million bonus that was agreed for meeting Subnautica 2 development targets back when the studio was acquired by Krafton in 2021.

item.title: Star Trek Fleet Command Codes (September 2025)
item.description:
Star Trek Fleet Command is an interesting and content-packed game inspired by the iconic Star Trek series. You play the role of a spaceship captain and lead the development of an empire. Your responsibilities will include collecting materials for the construction of new structures, participating in the war against the invaders, and much more, which will take a lot of time and resources. Luckily, you can redeem Star Trek Fleet Command Codes to get cool gifts from the developers that will definitely come in handy during your travels or development.

Updated September 17, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: You can use several codes in Star Trek Fleet Command to claim different rewards that may help you progress faster. Some codes provide character shards, while others unlock boosts, resources, or event-related items. A few require you to reach certain Ops levels before you can redeem them, so be sure to check the requirements. Since codes can expire or change, it’s worth coming back regularly to see if new ones are available.

Star Trek Fleet Command: All Codes

As mentioned above, you will need plenty of resources to develop your empire, build new structures and ships, and even join an alliance. Some of them are extremely rare, and not all of them can be bought with currency, which will take quite a while to obtain. Using Star Trek Fleet Command codes, you can provide yourself with some of these resources quickly and for free.

Active Codes

  • Cadet - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • Warpspeed - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • TNG - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • Commander - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • Frontier - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • FleetCommand Boost - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • WOKPT1 - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • SECTION31 - Redeem this code to get rewards
  • Renegade - Redeem this code to get 5 Epic Tolra Shards and Starfleet Honors
  • Rogue - Redeem this code to get 5 Epic Tolra Shards and Syndicate Points
  • GQ7 - Redeem this code to get 2 Nesmith, 2 Laliari, 2 Alexander, and 125 MU Research Dust R5
  • GQ5 - Redeem this code to get 2 Nesmith, 2 Laliari, 2 Alexander, and 11,250 Loyalty Points
  • AlterEgo - Redeem this code to get 5 Mirror Kira Shards and 750 Section 31 Mirror Ciphers
  • Reflection - Redeem this code to get 5 Mirror Kira Shards
  • THEMIRROR - Redeem this code to get 5 Mirror Picard
  • EVISCERATOR - Redeem this code to get Exclusive rewards (To redeem this code, you need to reach Ops 10+)
  • ENT3 - Redeem this code to get Artifact Shards (To redeem this code, you need to reach Ops 38+)
  • NX-01 - Redeem this code to get Exclusive rewards (To redeem this code, you need to reach Ops 40+)
  • KIRK - Redeem this code to get Ultra Recruit Token x4000 and James T. Kirk shards x100

Expired Codes

  • WOKPT2
  • Crushers
  • BOLDLYGO
  • YOHP2
  • VOY30
  • YOH13
  • YOH7
  • MMAonpoint
  • Fw7hi45A
  • tD3vFAuS

Star Trek Fleet Command: How to Redeem Codes

Redeeming Star Trek Fleet Command codes is a bit difficult, as you can't do it directly in the game. Instead, you will need to register or log in to a Scopely account that is linked to your game profile. If you've already linked Scopely before, here's how to redeem the codes:

  • Launch the game.
  • Pay attention to the upper right part of the screen. There should be a button labeled Claim. Click on it.
  • This will open the Gifts menu with various options listed. Among them, find and interact with the one that says Redeem and the container image.
  • After doing so, you will be taken to the game's website, where you will need to log in with your Scopely account.
  • After authorization, you will eventually be taken directly to the code redemption page, where there will be an input field and a yellow Redeem button.
  • Now, choose one of the above active codes and enter it manually or copy and paste it into the input field.
  • Next, click the Redeem button to submit the request. If everything is successful, you will see a notification on the screen about the rewards you have received.
  • The last thing you need to do to collect them is to launch the game, wait for the download to complete, and then the rewards you received will be displayed on the screen.

It's worth noting that some players may experience an error when redeeming a code, even if they didn't make a mistake while typing the code, or if the code hasn't expired yet. The fact is that to get rewards from certain codes, you will first need to fulfill certain conditions, in this case, reach a certain Ops level. For some of the above codes, we have additionally written these conditions by level in parentheses, so if you have not met these requirements, you will not be able to receive rewards until you do.

Star Trek Fleet Command is available on PC, Android, and iOS.
